Parse data and parameters of OPUS binary file of a Bruker spectrometer

Source: R/parse_opus.R
parse_opus.Rd

This function can be used to read and parse OPUS files, to make it usable for other processing steps.

parse_opus(raw, data_only)

Arguments

raw

data source name; can be a file path to an OPUS file or directly a raw vector

data_only

TRUE or FALSE if only the ab or refl data should be returned

Value

list containing the different data chunks of an OPUS file, possibly:

  • refl_data_param:

  • refl:

  • quant_report_refl:

  • sc_sample_data_param:

  • sc_sample:

  • sc_ref_data_param:

  • sc_ref:

  • optics:

  • optics_ref:

  • acquisition_ref:

  • fourier_transformation_ref:

  • fourier_transformation:

  • sample:

  • acquisition:

  • instrument_ref:

  • instrument:

  • lab_and_process_param_1:

  • lab_and_process_param_2:

  • info_block:

  • history:

See also

Core functions read_opus()

Examples

library(opusreader2)

dsn <- system.file(
  "extdata/test_data/BF_lo_01_soil_cal.1",
  package = "opusreader2"
)

raw <- read_opus_raw(dsn)

opus_list <- parse_opus(raw, data_only = FALSE)
